content: boardwalk by elizabeth pedersen pattern with smaller size circular needles cast on 90 stitches place stitch marker at beginning or row and join in the round being careful not to twist work row 1 *k1 p1* row 2 - 11 repeat row 1 ten times 11 times total or until brim is desired length increase row switch to larger size 16 circular needles by knitting one row increasing one stitch m1l after every 15th stitch m1l - lift the bar between stitches with the tip of the lefthand needle from the front then knit the back the of the bar you have lifted like knitting through the back loop of a stitch six stitches increased for a total of 96 sts yarn approximately 130 yards of worsted begin section a follow either the chart weight yarn the pictured hats are both or the written instructions the sixteen made from one skein of malabrigo merino stitches in row one are repeated six times worsted 210 yards/100 grams 3 5 around working all stitches repeat ounces in colorways stone blue and pearl whichever row of the patern that you are currently working in this manner repeat gauge 20 sts and 27 row per 4 inches in all eight row of section a four times for a stockinette on us size 8 needles total of 32 patterned row needles 16 size us 5 16 size us 8 and begin section b please note that the one set double pointed needles size us 8 center decrease in section b is different than the decreases in section a - see notions stitch marker s darning needle legend for details switch to double pointed needles when necessary abbreviations sts - stitches finishing after completing section b k - knit there are 6 stitches remaining cut yarn p - purl leaving a 6 to 10 tail with a darning yo - yarn over needle run this tail through the remaining ssk - slip 1 as if to knit k1 psso 6 stitches and cinch together weave in all k2tog - knit 2 together ends and wash and block finished hat if sl - slip as if to knit you wish to make a slouchier hat you can psso/p2sso - pass slipped stitch es over go up needle sizes for sections a and b sl2tog - sl 2 sts together as if to k2tog and/or you can stretch the finished hat * * -
